Comments_List: I learned the entire basic grammar of Latin, and also was able to refine my study and time management skills.
I learned the fundamentals of Latin grammar, lots of new vocabulary, how to analyze a sentence, and a good deal of Roman history.
A solid working knowledge of Latin grammar, including the entire verb system, noun system, etc., in preparation for reading real, actual Latin.
I have learned the basic concepts of Latin grammar and have been able to apply them to reading Latin.

The strength of the course is Tim. He is extremely knowledgeable and positivewithout him it would have been easy to become discouraged with the workload and pace of the course, which I consider to be the weakness.
It is a hyper-aggressive course; I'd suggest not taking it concurrently with anything else!
There is a lot of information to take in in just 5 weeks. They course could be longer so as to allow students more time to process concepts.

I would recommend this course if you are interested in languages, linguistics, the classics, Rome, or anything related to Latin. You'll need to be interested because this class is tough and there's a LOT of work, but Professor Robinson is excellent and funny and makes the class a lot of fun, while also being an incredibly intelligent and insightful teacher.

I would recommend the class to another student as being extremely interesting; however, I would also mention that the pressure to master so much information in such little time could prevent someone from engaging with the language as much as one would like.

Absolutely! But this is not a class for the faint of heart; if you're taking the summer module, I'd suggest not taking it concurrently with another class, because the workload is quite aggressive. That said, you get a lot out of it!

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. Although it is pretty intensive course, the materials and the explanations of the professor allow the students to grasp the elements of Latin Grammar very easily. The fact that the students learn to read Latin in just a few days makes the course really attractive. The fast improvement makes the effort worthwhile.
Yes, if that student was interested in Latin or required it for research.
